United States: The Statue of Liberty was a gift from France.
Canada: Canada has more lakes than the rest of the world combined.
United Kingdom: The UK is made up of Great Britain and Northern Ireland.
France: France is the most visited country in the world.
Germany: Germany has over 1,500 different types of beer.
Japan: Japan is made up of over 6,800 islands.
India: India is the world's largest democracy.
Brazil: Brazil is the only country in South America that speaks Portuguese.
Australia: Australia is the only continent that is also a country.
China: The Great Wall of China is the longest wall in the world.
South Korea: South Korea has the fastest average internet speed in the world.
Italy: Italy is home to the world's oldest university, the University of Bologna, founded in 1088.
Mexico: Mexico introduced chocolate, chilies, and corn to the world.
Russia: Russia is the largest country in the world by land area.
Egypt: The Great Pyramid of Giza is the last remaining wonder of the ancient world.
South Africa: South Africa has three capital cities: Pretoria, Cape Town, and Bloemfontein.
Argentina: Argentina was the first country to use fingerprints for criminal identification.
Saudi Arabia: Saudi Arabia is home to the world's largest sand desert, the Rub' al Khali (Empty Quarter).
Switzerland: Switzerland has four official languages: German, French, Italian, and Romansh.
Spain: Spain produces over 40% of the world's olive oil.
Turkey: Istanbul is the only city in the world that spans two continents: Europe and Asia.
Greece: Greece is the birthplace of the Olympic Games, which began in 776 BC.
Thailand: Thailand is home to the world's smallest mammal, the bumblebee bat.
Vietnam: Vietnam is the world's second-largest exporter of coffee, after Brazil.
Indonesia: Indonesia is the world's largest archipelago, consisting of over 17,000 islands.
Philippines: The Philippines has the world's longest underground river, located in Palawan.
Norway: Norway has a town called Hell, which freezes over every winter.
Sweden: Sweden is home to the worldâ€™s first ice hotel, built in 1989.
Finland: Finland has more saunas than cars.
Netherlands: The Netherlands is the world's largest exporter of tulips.
Iceland: Iceland has no mosquitoes due to its cold climate.
New Zealand: New Zealand was the first country to grant women the right to vote in 1893.
Portugal: Portugal is the oldest country in Europe with the same defined borders since 1139.
Pakistan: Pakistan is home to the second-highest mountain in the world, K2.
Chile: Chile's Atacama Desert is the driest place on Earth, with some areas never receiving rainfall.
Tajikistan: Around 93% of Tajikistan is covered by mountains, making it one of the most mountainous countries in the world.
